flow.descriptionCdata:
de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.01339e1a-6c97-4f03-93a9-fd1478893718.prompt=CSA_PROCESS_ID de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.05d1eff9-5a6c-4bb5-a2bc-fcf1ae052f38.callout=(Nucleus_Migration design specification v23 )\:3.17.4.5 SERV Modify CMD Disk Size de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.174992a5-d077-4816-9542-d3d258818218.description=
This operation running scriptlet from Inputs, It can be used to script flow.
attention that do'not used Scriptlet tab, it need empty can be running script from Inputs script. 
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
diskVolumeSize	-  DISK.volumeSize	
diskVolumeSize_Old	- DISK.volumeSize_OLD	

errorComponent   - ${SERVER.RESPRVFQDN};${SERVER.VMPATH};${SERVER.VMUUID}	
Scriptlet - write on javascript.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output.

       errorCode  from returnResult scriptlet\:    scriptletResult \= scriptletContext.get("errorCode"); 
       errorComponent   from returnResult scriptlet\:   scriptletResult \= scriptletContext.get("errorComponent");

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure   -  The operation failure as stated in the description.
    other -  The operation other as stated in the description.
de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.363b87e0-912b-4ef3-8a54-073ec724e5f9.description=
This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API.

Inputs\:
_PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id
_processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State)



Result\:
_processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State

de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.4f12a47c-7214-4f6c-981f-456f4f6ddc9d.description=
This operation running scriptlet from Inputs, It can be used to script flow.
attention that do'not used Scriptlet tab, it need empty can be running script from Inputs script. 
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    Scriptlet - write on javascript.

diskFileSystem	
diskFileSystem_Old	
csaUpdateJsonType1\=   "FILESYSTEM"\: {
        "displayName"\: "DISK FILESYSTEM",
        "values"\: "${DISK.FILESYSTEM_OLD}",
        "consumerVisible"\: "false",
        "valueType"\: "STRING"
    }->Value\:     "FILESYSTEM"\: {
        "displayName"\: "DISK FILESYSTEM",
        "values"\: "${DISK.FILESYSTEM_OLD}",
        "consumerVisible"\: "false",
        "valueType"\: "STRING"
    }	
csaUpdateJsonType2	\=getCsaUpdateJsonType	


Results\:
csaUpdateJsonType

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure   -  The operation failure as stated in the description.
    other -  The operation other as stated in the description.
de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.54fc1db1-61b2-49d6-88e9-98b68cd4751c.description=
Create Event subflow will create a line in the automation log file. The log line is generated from returned value with provided subscription ID.

 
Inputs\:
SubscriptionID  	Subscription ID from CSA
ERRORCODE		The returned error code for the failure from CSA
ERRORDATE                       The retured error date for the failure from CSA
ERRORMSG                        The returned error message for the failure from CSA
ERRORCOMPONENT	The component where we have the failure from CSA
AdditionalInfo                     The additional information for the failure from CSA

Responses\:
failure\:		fail to write log to automation log file
success\:		log has been written to automation log file successfully
de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.56491ad2-5c52-4dc0-b1fa-d425119d2b17.callout=Update PA Status\: -Inputs\: processReturnCode, processInstanceState de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.56e8a7c8-6f4c-44b8-8efa-dfd5a93308ab.description=
This flow updates many properties in a give CSA component, the properties can either be defined in a propertyList or using the propertyJSON format.
If you use propertyJSON the propertyList, propertyType and seperator will be ignored.

Inputs\:
SVC_COMPONENT_ID - The ID of the service component to update
userIdentifier - The ID of the Transport User
propertyList	- A key\:value pair list of properties seperated by ${seperator}
propertyJSON - a json array of properties see note1. for formatting.
propertyType - The type of property e.g STRING or LIST
seperator - The value used to seprate properties in the property list

Responses\: 
Success - The flow executed sucessfully
Failure - Something went wrong

Note1.  The JSON object must include displayName and values properties, the consumerVisible and valueType are optional.the name of each object in the JSON will be the name of the property in CSA
{"HOSTNAME"\:{
	"displayName"\:"hostname", 
	"values"\:"blahblah",
	"consumerVisible"\:"true",
	"valueType"\:"STRING"  //Can be STRING, ENUM or INTEGER (ENUM is a list)
	}
}

Note2. propertyJSON expects the values are correctly formed JSON, ensure any variables used in the string are JSON safe or encode them.
de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.56e8a7c8-6f4c-44b8-8efa-dfd5a93308ab.prompt=[ {"name"\:"BACKUPOPTION","value"\:"${bkOption}","displayname"\:"Backup Option"}, {"name"\:"BACKUPOPTION_OLD","value"\:"${bkOption}","displayname"\:"Backup Option Old","visible"\:"false"} ] BACKUPOPTION\:${bkOption}, de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.57438478-4236-46f0-b537-cfdbcefe9670.callout=Get Disk Properties\: -Input\: propertyNames\: prefix\:DISK -Results\: global(DISK.*) de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.6601d1ed-b5f5-45ff-9f3e-2cd9cfdaec6c.callout=(Nucleus_Migration design specification v413 )\:3.17.4.5 SERV Modify CMD Disk Size This Process Action triggers the modification of a Disk to FlexUp the Disk Size. It should be attached to the Disk Component of a Virtual server. de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.699f9b4c-f98b-4fb7-be50-f3101a1025c2.description=
This flow gets the lastRequestId from CSA by using the legacy user api  application/JSON content-type 

Inputs\: 
CSA_OO_USER	
REQ_ORG_ID	
REQ_USER_ID	  U-ser Identifier id
SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID	
SVC_INSTANCE_ID	 –   Service Instance Id
CSA_CONTEXT_ID	
CSA_PROCESS_ID	

SVC_INSTANCE_ID –   Service Instance Id
userIdentifier  - User Identifier id

Outputs\:
SVC_ROOT_COMPONENT_ID	
SVC_CATALOG_ID	
SVC_REQUEST_ID	
userIdentifier	
subscriptionName	
orgName	
errrorComponent	
errorCode	

Scriptlet\:
Get CSA variables to Set Global variables on Get Server Meta
/Nucleus Base/Library/TP Cloud/Subflows/Nucleus Base/Get Service Meta
de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.699f9b4c-f98b-4fb7-be50-f3101a1025c2.prompt=Get CSA variables to Set Global variables on Get Server Meta /Nucleus Base/Library/TP Cloud/Subflows/Nucleus Base/Get Service Meta de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.6eab7941-9aa9-474d-97a9-12a325744f02.prompt=CSA_CONTEXT_ID de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.7845f9d2-d0b9-41a2-ba48-fea2d8475ad1.callout=Check Disk Enable\: -Inputs\: diskEnable_Old, diskEnable -response\: If diskEnable_Old \!\= diskEnable then goto add/removed de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.7de90371-2aa7-4d39-b123-c4aa58f4b62d.callout=Update to CSA\: -Inputs\: propertyJSON\=csaUpdateJsonType, userIdentifier, SVC_COMPONENT_ID, -Scritlet\: errorCode\=223 de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.8a336ba5-dc2b-406a-bee1-2f1d30de2b00.callout=Get Server Properties\: -Inputs\: propertyNames\:list, prefi\:SERVER global(SERVER.*) de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.8bc6b489-e0d3-4e28-a8ec-53c2dbc22cd8.description=
This operation running scriptlet from Inputs, It can be used to script flow.
attention that do'not used Scriptlet tab, it need empty can be running script from Inputs script. 
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    diskEnable -	DISK.DISKENABLE	   
    diskEnable_Old -  DISK.DISKENABLE_OLD	

    Scriptlet - write on javascript.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output.
    default this operation return errorCode and errorComponent that donot need add errorCode and errorComponent
    if you want add errorCode and errorComponent used below scriptlet, please refer Outputs sample
       errorCode  from returnResult scriptlet\:    scriptletResult \= scriptletContext.get("errorCode"); 
       errorComponent   from returnResult scriptlet\:   scriptletResult \= scriptletContext.get("errorComponent");
Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure   -  The operation failure as stated in the description.
    other -  The operation other as stated in the description.
de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.8bc6b489-e0d3-4e28-a8ec-53c2dbc22cd8.prompt=DATACENTER|SERVERID|DCACRONYM|BACKUPSERVERID|BACKUPSERVERIP|FQDN|VLANBUR|hostName|BACKUPOPTION|BACKUPCSID|BACKUPENABLE|BACKUPENABLE_OLD| de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.8be612c9-dc74-4029-94a1-186132bbc443.callout=Get from CSA\: -Result userIdentifier, subscriptionName, orgName, -Scriptlet\: global(CSA.*) de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.90574d60-b453-439e-8bc6-1ddae9f90169.callout=Check FileSystem\: -Inputs\: scriptlet, diskFileSystem, diskFileSystem_Ols, csaUpdateJsonType1, csaUpdateJsonType1, -Results\: hide(csaUpdateJsonType) de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.bd785893-2fe6-4e25-8520-5e06a90f6aa5.callout=warp Flex Disk Up CMO\: -Inputs\: global(DISK.*,SERVER.*,CSA.*, vcenter.*) -Results\: getCsaUpdateJsonType, errorCode, errorComponent de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.c2b28ac4-cb6e-48bc-80f1-86210e5f5c21.callout=Get User and Password\: -Inputs\: serviceAccountList -Results\: errorCode,errorComponent -Scriptlet\: global(*.username,*.password) de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.d50c943a-0549-46db-983e-326cfa692bbb.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.de0d86f8-cc7c-4616-9e36-1f208528b575.callout=Check DiskSize\: -Inputs\: diskVolumeSize, diskVolumeSize_Old, -Outputs\: csaUpdateJsonType -response\: other\:\= size\=\= oldIsize, failure\:\= size < oldsize, success\:\= size> oldsize de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.description=
This Flow will attempt to Unregister for Backup as part of Service Deprovisionig.

Inputs\:

CSA_CONTEXT_ID		- CSA Context Id
CSA_PROCESS_ID		- CSA Process Instance Id
SVC_COMPONENT_ID 		- This token will resolve to the Service component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:SVC_COMPONENT_ID]
RSC_PROVIDER_ID		- This token will resolve to the Resource Provider Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:RSC_PROVIDER_ID]
SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL 	- This token will resolve to the subscriber’s email address. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL]
RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID 		- This token will resolve to the Resource Subscription Id that was created from the Resource Offering at the Subscription time.
			   Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE		- This token will resolve to the Service component type. Eg\: Server.. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE]
RSC_POOL_ID		- This token will resolve to the Resource pool Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_POOL_ID]
SVC_INSTANCE_ID		- This token will resolve to the Service Instance Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_INSTANCE_ID]
SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID		- This token will resolve to the Subscription Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
PRN_COMPONENT_ID		- This token will resolve to the parent Component’s Service Component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: PRN_COMPONENT_ID]
REQ_ORG_ID 		- This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_ORG_ID]
REQ_USER_ID 		- This token will resolve to the User Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_USER_ID]
USR_ORG_ID 		- This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the subscriber. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: USR_ORG_ID]
RSC_BINDING_ID 		- This token will resolve to the Resource Binding Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_BINDING_ID]
INTERVAL 			- This is the default value for how long to wait between Operation Retries.
RETRY			- This value determines how many retries should be attempted before an error event is raised.

These tokens with the default values are resolved by CSA when the flow is invoked.

Responses\:
success - Workflow completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.ecc43c65-c3a1-4585-9747-61bc0be27e98.description=
This flow takes a list of system account names and returns a username and password for each one as a flow output variable. The password fields will remain Obfuscated.
If two vcenter accounts are selected then the second will be output as a remote vcenter credentials.

Inputs\:
serviceAccountList - A comma seperated list of system account names (eg. nucl.vcenter.${RESPRVFQDN},nucl.moe.${VCENTERHOSTNAME})

VCenter-Accounts\: if requesting two vcenter account, the first is mapped to vcenter.username/vcenter.password, the second to vcenter.remoteUsername/vcenter.remotePassword
(e.g\: 
  serviceAccountList\=nucl.vcenter.${FQDN1},nucl.vcenter.${FQDN2}
or 
  serviceAccountList\=nucl.vcenter.${FQDN1},nucl.vcenter.cmo.${FQDN1}
)

Outputs\:
moe.username 	- The username for the MOE account
moe.password 	- The password for the MOE account Obfuscated)
sa.username	 	- The username for the HPSA account 
sa.password 	- The password for the HPSA account (Obfuscated)
vcenter.username	- The password for the vcenter account
vcenter.password	- The password for the vcenter account (Obfuscated)
vcenter.remoteUsername	- The username for a second vcenter account 
vcenter.remotePassword	- The password for a second vcenter account (Obfuscated)

Scriptlet\:
Get CSA variables to Set Global variables on Get System Accounts
/Nucleus Base/Library/TP Cloud/Subflows/Nucleus Base/Get System Accounts
de51d3fb-4057-40ab-b744-18980e6fdf53.fa4dd390-dfe7-41f2-90b8-5964feccfaea.description=
This flow updates many properties in a give CSA component, the properties can either be defined in a propertyList or using the propertyJSON format.
If you use propertyJSON the propertyList, propertyType and seperator will be ignored.

Inputs\:
SVC_COMPONENT_ID - The ID of the service component to update
userIdentifier - The ID of the Transport User
propertyList	- A key\:value pair list of properties seperated by ${seperator}
propertyJSON - a json array of properties see note1. for formatting.
propertyType - The type of property e.g STRING or LIST
seperator - The value used to seprate properties in the property list

Responses\: 
Success - The flow executed sucessfully
Failure - Something went wrong

Note1.  The JSON object must include displayName and values properties, the consumerVisible and valueType are optional.
{"HOSTNAME"\:{
	"displayName"\:"hostname", 
	"values"\:"blahblah",
	"consumerVisible"\:"true",
	"valueType"\:"STRING" 
	}
}
